newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Sept 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Sept 12.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Thursday:
* Two assistant secretaries at the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services resigned in protest over the sharp cuts contained in the welfare bill recently signed by President Clinton.
* The United States sent more warplanes to the Middle East in preparation for heavier attacks on Iraq after Iraq fired a missile at U.S. jets patrolling the no-fly zone.
* Voter turnout by Republicans has become a growing issue as GOP nominee Sen. Bob Dole trails President Clinton.
* Economists debated whether the Federal Reserve should raise interest rates, asserting that the central bank should allow the economy to grow at its current pace a while longer.
* President Clinton is planning for a star-studded fundraiser in Beverly Hills, Calif., that is expected to yield $3.5 million.
* Network Solutions Inc, the private company commissioned by the federal government to register Internet and World Wide Web addresses, is considering a public stock offering.
* Despite years of claims by the Brazilian government that cutting of rain forests has slowed, new figures show the opposite.
